messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On March 9, DET. S. T. Jennings was notified about a series of car break-ins at the Willowbrook Shopping Center. Primary informants were Mrs. Rogers, a shopper, and Mr. Fernandez, the security guard. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. U. V. Fisher - OPERATIONS Det. Jennings, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective W. X. Griffin and Detective Y. Z. Harper were summoned to the scene. DIXON 12:10 Car Break-In Mrs. Rogers found her purse missing, while Mr. Fernandez mentioned observing a suspicious group earlier. CCTV. Technician Piper analyzed security camera footage. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Jennings Sr, Det. Griffin, Det. Harper OPERATIONS Lt. Fisher INFORMANT Fernandez, Carlos 72 Maple Drive, Willowbrook, Florida 165-630. 93135. DIXON 12:10 Car Break-In By 2:45 PM, Detectives Jennings, Griffin, and Harper, led by Lieutenant Fisher, identified a trio from the footage. Captain A. B. Lane coordinated with neighboring precincts. Sergeant C. D. Murphy and Sergeant E. F. Nolan started gathering statements from other affected shoppers. By 4:20 PM, two suspects were in custody, and one remained at large. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Jennings Sr, Det. Griffin, Det. Harper OPERATIONS Lt. Fisher AFFIDAVIT - Car Break-In Report 1) Security Tapes 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) List of Stolen Items 5) Parking Lot Entry Records (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE G. Morgan W.S.P.D. 20.50 P50 2277 Rogers, EMILY NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 130-2579 DETECTIVE: S. JENNINGS ITEM: 50-4950- 97 CRIME: 12:10 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 82750 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 9/15/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. S. T. Jennings  Officer Context: On March 9, DET. S. T. Jennings was notified about a series of car break-ins at the Willowbrook Shopping Center. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. U. V. Fisher  Officer Context: Lt. U. V. Fisher - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective W. X. Griffin  Officer Context: Detective W. X. Griffin and Detective Y. Z. Harper were summoned to the scene. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Y. Z. Harper  Officer Context: Detective W. X. Griffin and Detective Y. Z. Harper were summoned to the scene. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Piper  Officer Context: CCTV. Technician Piper analyzed security camera footage. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Jennings  Officer Context: By 2:45 PM, Detectives Jennings, Griffin, and Harper, led by Lieutenant Fisher, identified a trio from the footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Griffin  Officer Context: By 2:45 PM, Detectives Jennings, Griffin, and Harper, led by Lieutenant Fisher, identified a trio from the footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Harper  Officer Context: By 2:45 PM, Detectives Jennings, Griffin, and Harper, led by Lieutenant Fisher, identified a trio from the footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain A. B. Lane  Officer Context: Captain A. B. Lane coordinated with neighboring precincts. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant C. D. Murphy  Officer Context: Sergeant C. D. Murphy and Sergeant E. F. Nolan started gathering statements from other affected shoppers. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Nolan Officer Context: Sergeant C. D. Murphy and Sergeant E. F. Nolan started gathering statements from other affected shoppers. Officer Role: Sergeant
